availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Ackerman (Pendleton County, KY, private 42nd Ky Enrolled Militia)

body.p: Campbell County, Kentucky, soldier. Native of Bavaria. Married to Louise Ackerman. Father of Louise Ackerman, Caroline Ackerman, and Mary Ackerman. Signed a petition to Beriah Magoffin on behalf of William A Clark in Pendleton County, Kentucky, on April 29, 1862. Served in the 42nd Regiment Kentucky Enrolled Militia as a private from September 2, 1862, to October 2, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 419B.
